snippet: Almost 36 million people are living as slaves across the globe, according to a human rights group, with India having the largest number over all and Mauritania the highest percentage of its population.
abstract: Human rights group Walk Free Foundation releases index that estimates almost 36 million people are living as slaves across the globe; index lists Mauritania, Uzbekistan, Haiti, Qatar and India as nations where modern-day slavery is most prevalent.
lead_paragraph: Almost 36 million people are living as slaves across the globe, according to a human rights group, with India having the largest number over all and Mauritania the highest percentage of its population.

headline.main: Millions Forced to Live as Slaves, a Human Rights Group Reports
headline.print_headline: Millions Forced to Live as Slaves, a Human Rights Group Reports

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
